#Text=Pécs
#Text=Pécs ( PEH-ch ) is a town in the south-west of Hungary .
#Text=Pécs is the administrative and economical centre of Baranya County
#Text=The city has Mediterranean atmosphere and a treasure-house of science , arts and sacrality .
#Text=It had famous and glorious periods .

#Text=Here are several values of the Roman times , the Middle Ages , the Turkish occupation and the development of the middle-class are built on one another or next to one another such as Gothic , Renaissance , baroque dwelling houses , Christian churches and Islamic houses of prayer , djamis and minarets , baths and public buildings .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Located on the slopes of the Mecsek mountains .
#Text=The heritage of the past goes back to the neolithic age .
#Text=The territory always provided good essential conditions for the different ethnic groups who settled down here , which is proven by the arcaheological findings excavated here .
#Text=Founded as Sopianae 2000 years ago by the Romans ( most relics date back to the this period ) and known as Fünfkirchen by the Germans .
#Text=After the period of migration , St. Stephen founded an episcopate in Pécs around 1009 .
#Text=Pope Urban signed the foundation document of the university during the reign of Lewis the Great , in 1367 , - consequently the town of Pécs became the seat of the first university of Hungary .

#Text=Today 's Pécs is a pleasant small ( but still one of the largest in Hungary ) university town that has largely escaped the ravages of both communist-era architecture and modern-day mass tourism .
#Text=In 2000 , the Early Christian Necropolis of Pécs was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List .
#Text=It is one of the European Capitals of Culture in 2010 .
#Text=By train
#Text=Railway Station ( MÁV ) , Szabadság út 39 . ( South of the Old Town , ten min by walk ) , ☏ +3640494949 , +36 72 215611 , ✉ eszrevetel@mav-start.hu .
#Text=There are frequent trains to Pécs from Budapest 's Déli or Keleti station - see Hungarian Railway Timetable .
#Text=The trip can be as fast as 2hr 40min on an express , but several hours longer by local clunker .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Bus Station ( Autóbuszállomás Pécs , Pécsi Távolságiautóbusz-állomás ) , Nagy Lajos király útja ( Northeast 600m of Railway Station ) , ☏ +3672 502-500 , fax : +3672 311-055 .
#Text=Season ticket Cashdesk M - F 06:30 – 18:00 , 06:30 – 12:00 .
#Text=Numerous buses from all directions ( including from cities in northern Croatia ) serve the city .
#Text=Buses to Budapest 's Nepliget station operate numerous times daily ( timetable ) , though the trip is slower than the train , and far less scenic or comfortable .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Pécs Airport ( Pécs-Pogány Repülőtér ) , Pogány Village ( 6 km south ) , ☏ +3672526140 , fax : +3672 526-144 , ✉ info@airportpecs.hu .
#Text=Year-round flights to Corfu in Greece .
#Text=There are no timetabled , domestic flights operating in Hungary .
#Text=Get around

#Text=The core of Pécs is small enough to cover on foot , but for those who wish to explore the town , there is a cheap and efficient bus service , single tickets are available for Ft 400 from the driver or Ft 300 from the many kiosks dotted around the city .
#Text=Make sure you have tickets , the bus inspectors have no mercy and will fine clueless foreigners .
#Text=Volan Taxi and Euro Taxi are both safe .
#Text=Holy Places
#Text=Early Christian monuments ( Kora keresztény síremlékek ) , Multiple ( Szent István tér , Apáca utca ) ( in the Old Town , close to Csontváry Museum ) .
#Text=Remains of Sopianae , the Roman city of some 8-10,000 people in Pannonia Province , are found at several points below the inner city .
#Text=The most important one is the Early Christian Necropolis , a World Heritage site dating back to the 4th century and the largest necropolis remaining in the European provinces .

#Text=Seven of the burial chambers are open to the public under the name Cella Septichora ; the main visitors ’ complex includes Cella Septichora , the Peter-Paul Chamber ( Péter-Pál - sírkamra ) , the Chamber of Jugs ( Korsós sírkamra ) , a baptismal chapel converted into a burial site and chambers III , IV , XIX and XX .

#Text=Many of the chambers are unadorned ; some have surviving figurative and geometric frescoes dating back to the date of their construction and similar to Roman catacomb paintings in their style and symbology , including the St. Peter and Paul Chamber with one of the earliest depictions of Virgin Mary .
#Text=A unique feature of the site is the presence of two-level chambers , which served a dual role for burial site ( cubiculum ) and ceremonies ( memoria ) .
#Text=The Chamber in Apaca Street was built in 390 .
#Text=The Mosque of Pasha Quasim ( Gázi Kászim pasa dzsámija - Belvárosi Plébániatemplom ) , Széchenyi István square , 2 ( Near to Hotel Főnix ) , ☏ +36304740175 .

#Text=Built on site and from the stones of Saint Berthold ’s gothic church by Pasha Quasim the Victorious , the Turkish character of the church was restored during the most recent , early 1940s renovations .
#Text=Inside the building , which functions as a Catholic church , frescoes depicting quotes from the Qur’an from the 16th century are visible .

#Text=The other mosque in the city , built by Yakovali Hassan , is in Kórház Square at the western terminus of the main pedestrian street , and is also open for visit when not in religious use by the city ’s Muslim community .
#Text=Cathedral ( Pécsi bazilika és székesegyház ) , Szent István tér 14 ( Right north of Early Christian monuments ) , ☏ +3672513030 .
#Text=The Cathedral of Pécs dates back to the 11th century and the times of Peter Orseolo , second king of Hungary .
#Text=Bearing the traces of the Romanesque , Gothic and Renaissance periods as well as the Turkish conquest when it was partially used for storage .

#Text=It was renovated in Rococo and Classicist styles , but gained its modern form in the 1880s , when it was mostly restored to its imagined Romanesque origins , destroying much of the subsequent decorations .
#Text=On John Paul II ’s papal visit in 1990 , the Cathedral gained the rank of Basilica Minor .
#Text=Museums

#Text=Archaeological Exhibition ( Early Christian Mausoleum , Régészeti Kiállítás ) , Széchenyi tér 12 . ( By buses 34 , 35 and 36 from the railway station – get off at Barbakán bus stop and walk two minutes through Esze Tamás Street to Szent István Square . ) , ☏ +3672213719 , ✉ regeszet@jpm.hu .
#Text=The upper part of the two-storey building was a chapel while the lower part , decorated with murals depicting scenes from the Bible , functioned as a burial chamber .
#Text=Museum shop .
#Text=Guide available .
#Text=Adult Ft 1700 , reduced Ft 900 .
#Text=Entrance fee included visiting the Cella Septichora Visitor Centre ( 2014 ) .
#Text=House of Arts and Literature ( Művészetek és Irodalom Háza ) , Pécs , Széchenyi tér 7-8 , ☏ +3672510628 , fax : +3672510629 , ✉ info@pmh.hu .

#Text=An exhibition hall different - mostly contemporary - exhibitions in ' Elaphat building complex ' in the Hoitsy house ( late Baroque , end of the 18th century ) , and the Piatsek house ( second half of the 19th century ) .
#Text=Events : classical chamber music , jazz , and world music presentations , chamber theater and literary programs
#Text=Csontváry Museum ( Csontváry Múzeum ) , Janus Pannonius u. 11 . ( Centre ) , ☏ +3672310544 .
#Text=This museum houses the largest collection of visionary painter Tivadar Kosztka Csontváry .

#Text=A pharmacist by trade , Csontváry became a self-educated painter after receiving a vision at the age of 27 with a voice announcing “ you will be the greatest sunway painter , greater than Raphael ! ”

#Text=Gradually abandoning his civilian profession , he travelled the Mediterranean , North Africa and the Middle East as well as the Dual Monarchy for inspiration , and painted strange vistas of vivid colour in a unique style that has traces of post-impressionism and expressionism , but defies classification .
#Text=Csontváry has been praised by Dalí as the second greatest painter of the century after himself . A must-see . Ft 1200 .
#Text=Ethnographic Exhibition ( Néprajzi Kiállítás ) , Rákóczi u. 15 . ( East of Museum of Natural History ) , ☏ +3672 315-629 . Tu - Sa 10:00 - 16:00 .
#Text=It presents the material and spiritual culture of Hungarian and ethnic minority groups of Baranya county .
#Text=Here is the second largest textile collection of Hungary .
#Text=Ft 500 .
#Text=Gyugyi Laszlo Collection ( Gyugyi-gyűjtemény ) , Pécs , Zsolnay Vilmos utca 37 ( Next to Miner Museum ) , ☏ +3672500350 , +36 20 2354722 ( Mobil ) , ✉ latogato@zsn.hu .
#Text=Laszlo Gyugyi 's private collection .
#Text=It covers two period of art era is historicism and secession .
#Text=There are some of the most beautiful ceramics of the ' Golden Age ' of Zsolnay Factory .
#Text=Guided tour available by appointment Ft 5000 .
#Text=Adult Ft 1400 , reduced Ft 700 .
#Text=Photo/Video ticket Ft 500 .
#Text=Modern Hungarian Gallery I ( Modern Magyar Képtár I ) , Káptalan u. 4 . , ☏ +3672514040 . Tu - Sa 10:00 - 16:00 .
#Text=Amerigo Tot Museum .
#Text=http://www.jpm.hu/index.php?m=1&s=2&id=44 Martin Ferenc Museum .
#Text=A collection of works of Ferenc Martyn ( Kaposvar , 1899 - Pécs , 1986 ) , sculptor , painter , graphic designer , illustrator
#Text=Modern Hungarian Gallery II ( Modern Magyar Képtár II ) , Papnövelde u. 5 . ( Next to Miner Museum ) , ☏ +3672514040 , fax : +3672514042 , ✉ art@jpm.hu . Tu - Sa 10:00 - 16:00 .
#Text=A permanent exhibition of the Modern Hungarian Gallery presents the broadly interpreted 20th and 21st century Hungarian Art , paintings , sculptures , installations .
#Text=Ft 500 .
#Text=Miner Museum ( Mecseki Bányászati Múzeum ) , Káptalan utca 3 ( Old Town ) , ☏ +36302185659 , +36 99 338902 , ✉ info@kbm.hu . Tu - Sa 10:00 - 18:00 ( winter until 16:00 ) .
#Text=The Mining Museum of Pécs located in a part of the former wine cellar storage system with several levels below where they show eliminated coal and uranium mining relics of the region .
#Text=Adult 300 HUF , reduced 150 HUF .
#Text=Museum of Natural History ( Természettudományi Múzeum ) , Szabadság u. 2 . ( Located on south part of the Old Town ) , ☏ +3672213419 , ✉ termtud@jpm.hu . Tu - Sa 10:00-16 . :00 .
#Text=Adult Ft 500 , reduced Ft 250 .
#Text=Local History Exhibition ( Várostörténeti Kiállítás ) , Felsőmalom u. 9 . ( on eastern part of the Old Town ) , ☏ +3672310165 , +36 72 514040 , ✉ varostort@jpm.hu . Tu - Sa 10:00 - 16:00 .
#Text=The exhibition on the history of Pécs , between 1686 and 1948 , in a former tannery house .
#Text=On the first floor there are two interiors : one in biedermeier-style and a sitting-room from the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries .
#Text=In the exhibition there are objects , documents , photos , interiors , models of buildings and the town .
#Text=The intimate court of the tannery can add to the visitors ' impressions .
#Text=Gift shop .
#Text=Adult Ft 700 , reduced Ft 350 ( 2014 ) .

#Text=Pink Zsolnay Exhibition ( Rózsaszín Zsolnay Kiállítás ) , Zsolnay Vilmos utca 37 ( take bus to the Zsolnay Cultural Quarter : 2 , 2/A , 20 , 20/A , 21 , 31 , 31/A , 43 , 60 - Get off at " Zsolnay Negyed " or bus 27 , 40 - Get off at " Bóbita Bábszínház " or " Csillag utca " ) , ☏ +3672500350 , +36 20 2354722 ( mobile ) , ✉ visitor@zsn.hu .
#Text=The best of everyday objects for visitors .
#Text=Each piece is unique .
#Text=Guided tours can be ordered , available in different languages .
#Text=Adult Ft 1200 , reduced Ft 600 ( 2014 ) .
#Text=Planetarium of Pécs ( Planetárium Pécs ) , Zsolnay Vilmos utca 37 . ( See at ' Pink Zsolnay Exhibition ' ) , ☏ +3672500350 , +36 20 2354722 ( Mobil ) , ✉ latogato@zsn.hu .
#Text=Th - Su : according to schedule . Offers substantial pastime for all ages .
#Text=45-person capacity .
#Text=You can do time travel into the past and the future . Ft 1100/700 ( 2014 ) , in foreign language : Ft 4000 per group .
#Text=Puppet Museum and Theater , Pécs , Felsővámház utca 50 . , ☏ +3672210301 , +36 20 9675999 ( mobile ) , fax : +3672211791 , ✉ bobita@bobita.hu .
#Text=This is an interactive Puppet Museum .
#Text=Children can try out the old puppets , learn more information about the techniques of puppets .
#Text=Guided tours are available Ft 400 .
#Text=Renaissance Stonework ( Reneszánsz Kőtár ) , Káptalan u. 2 , ☏ +3672514046 . Tu - Sa 10:00 - 16:00 .
#Text=Ft 500 .

#Text=University History Collection ( Klimo Collection , PTE University Library , University History Museum , Egyetemtörténeti Gyűjtemény ) , Szepesy Ignác utca 1-3 . , ☏ +3672501600 , +36 72 22651 , fax : +3672325552 , ✉ tgyo@lib.pte.hu .
#Text=Nov-Mar : M - F 09:00 - 15:00 .
#Text=In the University Library .
#Text=Here can be seen the valuable Klimo-collection Ft 500 .
#Text=Vasarely Museum ( Vasarely Múzeum ) , Káptalan St 3 ( next to Miner Museum in the Old Town ) , ☏ +36308738129 ( Mobil ) . Tu - Su 10:00 - 18:00 .
#Text=Dedicated to the works of Victor Vasarely , founder of the op-art movement .
#Text=Faux-threedimensional paintings , gobelins and " kinetic statues " .
#Text=One of the three collections of Vasarely 's work besides Gordes ( France ) and Budapest . Ft 1200 .
#Text=Zsolnay Museum ( Zsolnay Múzeum ) , Káptalan utca 2 ( Centre , north of Vasarely Museum ) , ☏ +3672514040 .
#Text=An exhibit on the life , times and decorative ceramics of Vilmos Zsolnay and the Zsolnay Ceramic Factory .
#Text=The lustrous eosin glaze and colourful pyrogranite developed in the 1870s has given the Manufacture its fame and a Grand Prize at the 1878 Paris World Exhibition .
#Text=Eosin had gained particular significance in Hungarian Art Nouveau , and became a popular material for public and private buildings as well as art objects .

#Text=Although the fortunes of the company have been uneven , with world wars , family troubles , nationalisation in 1948 and the mass production of industrial ceramics , the hand-painted charm of the brand survives .

#Text=The museum collects the lustrous ceramics of the Zsolnay legacy in chronological order in addition to plans , documents and other relics of this cornerstone of the city ’s industrial heritage . Ft 1200 .
